cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: over southern Dominican Republic near Santo Domingo
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to strengthen over the Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the north-western Gulf Coast
cyclone.hours_of_strike: 0 (storm not expected to strike Ottawa Port District directly)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys, central Bahamas, western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northern and southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos, eastern-central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles now; later the entire north-western Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: BIRMINGHAM AL (nearest location in NHC wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Possible breezy conditions late week (<39 mph) as Laura’s remnants pass south of Illinois
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (inland river port, no coastal surge exposure)
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain and localized river rises on 27-28 Aug
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential navigation restrictions on the Illinois River if upstream rainfall raises river levels
